ru.myx.ae3.transfer.encoding.stream

Class SmtpOutputStream

  • Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • java.io.FilterOutputStream
        • ru.myx.ae3.transfer.encoding.stream.SmtpOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, AutoCloseable

    public class SmtpOutputStream
extends java.io.FilterOutputStream
    This OutputStream controls the formation of the output stream according to the rules of the SMTP protocol described in RFC 821. It promise that: 1) No bare line feed will occur. All new lines will be send in the canonical form with a '\r' followed by a '\n'. 2) All dots ('.') that start a new line will be presented transparent by adding another dot before it. This procedure is described in RFC 821 to make sure no messages are prematurely ended. To end a message or send a non-transparent dot the writeDot method must be used.
    Version:
    1.0.1 29/10/00
    Author:
    Lars J. Nilsson

        public void write(int b)
           throws java.io.IOException

      • writeDot

        public void writeDot()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Write an a dot ('.') to the output stream without making it transparent. This method can be used to end a SMTP DATA command.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
